alert.note: Alert for Ballard (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Union, Pulaski, western Johnson, Alexander, western Ballard, northern Mississippi, central Scott, east central Cape Girardeau and northeastern Stoddard Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Cobden to near Olive Branch to near Sikeston. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Olive Branch and Ware around 350 PM CDT. Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area around 355 PM CDT. Anna, Jonesboro and Cobden around 400 PM CDT. Tamms around 405 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bertrand, Mounds, Mound City, Charleston, Cairo, Goreville, Karnak, Wyatt and Lake Of Egypt Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 2 and 10. Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 42. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 6 and 21. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 69 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
